taskErrors.message: Unable to determine whether the UUID of the server is valid. The server hardware is reporting an invalid Product ID.
recommendedActions: Use the remote console and boot the server into the RBSU (ROM-Based Setup Utility).  Ensure that the Serial Number and Product ID are set correctly using information found on the server.  Reboot the server, wait until the remote console messages indicate that the server is no longer in POST (Power-On Self Test), then refresh the server hardware {"name":"CZJ9260730, bay 1","uri":"/rest/server-hardware/9A709CC4-DEF7-4760-8219-BDD5746F04B0"}.

taskErrors.message: Unable to update the current IP configuration for the iLO in {"name":"CZJ9260730, bay 1", "uri":"/rest/server-hardware/9A709CC4-DEF7-4760-8219-BDD5746F04B0"}.

Unable to configure ambient temperature mode, possibly because a server was not ready.
Unable to get server environment variable CQHTEL.
Unable to establish trusted communication with the server.
recommendedActions: Ensure the server hardware is either successfully booted, or powered off, then use the Reapply configuration action on the logical enclosure. If the problem persists, contact your authorized support representative, provide a support dump, and the following code. SM102

taskErrors.message: Unable to register this HPE OneView instance with iLO: Unable to establish trusted communication with the server..
recommendedActions: Ensure network connectivity to the iLO is available, reset the iLO using iLO web interface, wait for iLO to restart and refresh the server. If the problem persists, power cycle the server, wait for the server to complete Power On Self-Test (POST) and then refresh the server. If there are any active alerts for the server that are related to certificate based communication with the iLO, resolve the issue as per the resolution steps  provided in the alert and retry the operation.

taskErrors.message: Unable to configure NTP (Network Time Protocol) settings on the server iLO.
recommendedActions: Ensure network connectivity to the iLO is available, then refresh the server hardware. If the problem persists, reset the iLO and then refresh the server hardware again. If the problem still persists, remove and re-insert the server hardware.

taskErrors.message:
Unable to configure single sign-on (SSO) settings on the iLO at fe80:0:0:0:af1:eaff:fe71:a130%bond0, which are required to launch the iLO web interface and Java console without credentials.
Unable to find valid certification for requested remote host.
recommendedActions: The iLO might have reached the maximum number of certificates it can store.  Login to iLO at fe80:0:0:0:af1:eaff:fe71:a130%bond0 to remove any unneeded SSO certificates.  Reset the iLO and refresh the server hardware. If the problem persists, contact your authorized support representative and provide them with a support dump.
